data.md:MetaData: Internal bubble pressures in ice cores from temperature migration experiments
Temperature-driven bubble migration as proxy for internal bubble pressures and bubble trapping function in ice cores

The dataset includes1) Average physical properties for all ice samples in the experiments2) Migration velocities for all ice samples in the experiments3) Internal pressure for all bubbles of the RICE experiments4) Model results of bubbly ice densification for RICE.

Sample ID | µCT Sample # (local sample number) | Sample, optional label/labor no | Lab no | Scanco Medical Micro-CT, Snowbreeder 5 (Pinzer andSchneebeli 2009, Wiese and Schneebeli 2017) | µCT measurement (local instrument-specific measurement number) | Analysis | Density, ice | Density ice | Specific surface area, ice | SSA ice | Average bubble pressure in the entire evaluated sample | Pressure, air bubble | P air bubble | Average bubble pressure in the centre 1/8 of the evaluated sample | Air content of centre 1/8 of the evaluated sample | Volume air per mass ice | V air/m ice | Air content of entire evaluated sample | Bubble number density | Bubbles | Experiment Duration (hrs) | Experiment | Exp | Distance between the bottom thermistor to the bottom of the scanned sample | Distance | Dist | Average bubble radius, calculated from micro-CT SSA (specific surface area) | Radius, air bubble | R air bubble | Uniform resource locator/link to file | URL file
